cs.AI, cs.HC, cs.LG, cs.CY, cs.SI. 

The paper discusses an automated explanation facility for Bayesian conditioning aimed at improving user acceptance of probability-based decision support systems. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) sub-category, as it deals with automated reasoning and decision-making. Additionally, the paper focuses on improving user acceptance, which suggests that it may also belong to the Human-Computer Interaction (cs.HC) sub-category. The paper also discusses information processing and reasoning about conditional evidence, which suggests that it may belong to the Machine Learning (cs.LG) sub-category. The paper may also belong to the Cybersecurity (cs.CY) sub-category, as it discusses decision support systems, which may have implications for security. Finally, the paper may belong to the Social and Information Networks (cs.SI) sub-category, as it discusses improving user understanding and acceptance of probabilistic inference.
